item.title: 世界银行推出增加妇女经济机会的新战略
item.description: 世界银行周四宣布了一项新的性别战略，旨在通过社会保护以及宽带和资本的使用，增加妇女的经济机会，使她们能够参与全球经济。【原文：The World Bank announced on Thursday a new gender strategy aimed at boosting economic opportunities for women and enabling their participation in the global economy through social protection and access to broadband and capital.】

item.title: 美元随美国收益率下跌，股市在利率和大选风险中涨跌不一
item.description: 周五，美元处于守势，此前美元兑主要同业货币创下一个月来最大跌幅，原因是在国债价格低迷吸引买家后，美元收益率从近三个月高点回落。【原文：The dollar was on the defensive on Friday following its biggest drop in a month against major peers, as it tracked a retreat in U.S. yields from nearly three-month highs after depressed Treasury prices drew buyers.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，俄罗斯锌矿受制裁延迟导致供应计算错误
item.description: 三位知情人士称，西方对俄罗斯锌矿商 Ozernoye 的制裁使其难以更换提高产量所需的设备，这意味着对 2025 年锌矿供应量的预测可能过高。【原文：Western sanctions on Russia's zinc miner Ozernoye have left it struggling to replace equipment needed to ramp up output, three sources with knowledge of the matter said, meaning mined zinc supply forecasts for 2025 are likely to be too high.】

item.title: 澳航表示不反对卡塔尔入股维珍澳大利亚公司
item.description: 澳航主席兼首席执行官周五表示，澳航并不反对卡塔尔航空公司收购澳大利亚第二大航空公司维珍澳大利亚航空公司（Virgin Australia）25%股份的提议，并补充说，澳航的投资计划意味着它完全有能力参与竞争。【原文：Qantas Airways is not opposed to Qatar Airways' proposal to take a 25% stake in Australia's No. 2 carrier Virgin Australia, Qantas' chair and CEO said on Friday, adding its investment plan meant it was well-placed to compete.】

item.title: 日元摇摆不定，易受政治影响
item.description: 日元上周五在三个月低点附近徘徊，并将连续第四个星期下跌，因为周末日本将举行大选，这可能会使日本央行（BOJ）的政策正常化计划复杂化。【原文：The yen languished near a three-month trough on Friday and was headed for a fourth straight weekly loss, ahead of an election in Japan over the weekend that is likely to complicate the Bank of Japan's (BOJ) policy normalisation plans.】

item.title: 华为第三季度中国智能手机销量大增，苹果下滑
item.description: 研究公司 IDC 周五的数据显示，2024 年第三季度苹果公司 iPhone 在中国的销量下降了 0.3%，而华为则激增了 42%。【原文：Apple's iPhone sales in China in the third quarter of 2024 fell 0.3%, while Huawei surged 42%, data from research firm IDC showed on Friday.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势令交易商提心吊胆，石油有望实现周涨幅
item.description: 由于世界头号产油区中东地区的紧张局势以及加沙停火谈判将在未来几天重启，交易商们一直处于紧张状态，油价周五上涨，有望实现超过1%的周涨幅。【原文：Oil prices rose on Friday and are on track for a weekly gain of more than 1%, as tensions in the world's top oil-producing region, the Middle East, and a restart in Gaza ceasefire talks in the coming days kept traders on edge.】

item.title: 密苏里州将对谷歌审查保守派言论的指控进行调查
item.description: 密苏里州总检察长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）周四表示，他将就谷歌审查保守派言论的指控对谷歌展开调查。【原文：Missouri Attorney General Andrew Bailey said on Thursday he was launching an investigation into Google over allegations that it was censoring conservative speech.】

item.title: 巴西淡水河谷第三季度净利润下降 15
item.description: 世界最大的铁矿石生产商之一、巴西矿业公司淡水河谷周四称，其第三季度净利润同比下降 15%。【原文：Brazilian miner Vale , one of the world's largest iron ore producers, said on Thursday its third-quarter net profit fell 15% from a year earlier.】

item.title: 微软首席执行官纳德拉 2024 年薪酬因股票奖励增长 63% 至 7900 万美元
item.description: 据周四提交的一份文件显示，微软首席执行官萨蒂亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）2024财年的薪酬激增63%，达到7910万美元，这得益于他在这一年获得的股票奖励，当时这家科技巨头的市值突破了3万亿美元。【原文：Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's fiscal 2024 compensation surged 63% to $79.1 million, according to a filing on Thursday, helped by his stock awards in a year when the tech behemoth's market value breached $3 trillion.】

item.title: 日美两国财政部长在双边会议上讨论外汇走势
item.description: 日本财务省一位高级官员称，日本财务大臣加藤胜信与美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦在周四举行的双边会谈中讨论了近期汇率变动等话题。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato and U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen discussed recent exchange-rate moves, among other topics, in a bilateral meeting held on Thursday, a senior Japanese finance ministry official said.】

item.title: 首席执行官理查德-怀特（Richard White）决定因丑闻下台后，慧科股价大涨
item.description: 智科全球公司（WiseTech Global）的亿万富翁创始人兼首席执行官理查德-怀特（Richard White）在个人生活受到一系列损害性指控后，辞去了职务，但决定继续留在公司担任顾问。【原文：Shares of WiseTech Global sky-rocketed on Friday after its billionaire founder and CEO Richard White stepped down but decided to stay at the firm in a consulting role after a series of damaging allegations about his personal life.】

item.title: 白宫敦促波音公司和罢工工会努力达成协议
item.description: 白宫周四表示，鼓励波音公司和代表约 33,000 名罢工机工的工会继续努力达成协议，一天前工人们拒绝了这家飞机制造商的最新合同提议。【原文：The White House said on Thursday it was encouraging Boeing and the union representing about 33,000 striking machinists to continue working to reach a deal, a day after workers rejected the planemaker's latest contract offer.】

item.title: 大众的 Scout Motors 部门将提供电动 SUV 和卡车，并提供汽油发动机选项
item.description: 大众汽车公司的 Scout Motors 部门周四发布了其概念电动 SUV 和卡车，并表示将提供包含小型汽油发动机的增程版本。【原文：Volkswagen's Scout Motors unit on Thursday unveiled its concept electric SUV and truck and said it will offer extended-range versions that include a small gasoline engine.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳航称工程师罢工预计不会对客户造成影响
item.description: 澳大利亚国旗航空公司澳航（Qantas Airways）周五表示，预计在定于当天晚些时候召开的年度股东大会之前，公司部分工程工作组计划举行的罢工不会对客户造成影响。【原文：Australia's flag carrier Qantas Airways said on Friday it does not expect an impact on customers from a strike planned by some of its engineering work groups ahead of the annual general meeting scheduled for later in the day.】

item.title: 澳航预计全球油价下跌将降低燃油成本
item.description: 澳大利亚国旗航空公司澳航（Qantas）周五表示，在全球航空燃油价格下跌后，该公司预计燃油成本将低于此前的估计。【原文：Australian flag carrier Qantas said on Friday it expects lower fuel costs than previously estimated after a drop in global jet fuel prices.】

item.title: 澳大利亚怀特黑文煤炭公司第一季度产量增长 82
item.description: 澳大利亚怀特黑文煤炭公司（Whitehaven Coal）周五公布的第一季度产量增长了82%，这得益于该公司从必和必拓（BHP）手中收购的炼焦煤业务产量上升，因为该公司正转向冶金煤。【原文：Australia's Whitehaven Coal posted an 82% rise in first-quarter output on Friday, aided by rising production at coking-coal operations it bought from BHP as the miner pivots towards metallurgical coal.】

item.title: 早间竞价市场低迷，关注日本
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 由于美国大选和地缘政治的不确定性，银行家认为投资不温不火
item.description: 聚集在华盛顿的银行高管们表示，有关美国走向的问题以及乌克兰和中东战争正在让投资者变得谨慎。【原文：Questions about the direction of the United States and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East are making investors cautious, bank executives gathered in Washington said.】

item.title: 墨西哥 Televisa 第三季度扭亏为盈
item.description: 周四公布的一份文件显示，墨西哥最大的广播公司 Televisa 第三季度实现净利润 6.665 亿比索（3385 万美元），而去年同期为亏损 9.185 亿比索。【原文：Mexico's largest broadcaster, Televisa, swung to a 666.5 million peso ($33.85 million) net profit in the third quarter from the 918.5 million peso loss in the same period a year earlier, according to a filing published on Thursday.】

item.title: 消费贷款机构 Capital One 第三季度利润增长，因为高利率增加了收入
item.description: Capital One 周四公布的第三季度利润增长了 1.6%，原因是利率上升使这家消费贷款公司从偿还信用卡债务的客户那里获得了更多收益。【原文：Capital One reported a 1.6% increase in third-quarter profit on Thursday, as elevated interest rates enabled the consumer lender to earn more from customers repaying credit card debt.】

item.title: 全球紧张局势下，L3Harris下调2024年业绩预期
item.description: L3Harris 公司周四上调了其年度利润和收入预期的下限，在全球安全问题不断升级的情况下，押注于持续的武器需求和强劲的国防开支。【原文：L3Harris raised the lower end of its annual profit and revenue forecasts on Thursday, betting on sustained weapons demand and robust defense spending amid escalating global security concerns.】

item.title: 美国法院阻止 Tapestry 85 亿美元收购竞争对手 Capri
item.description: 周四，一名美国法官阻止了美国手提包及配饰制造商 Tapestry 和 Capri 的 85 亿美元并购案，这是美国联邦贸易委员会在并购挑战罕见的行业中取得的一次胜利。【原文：A U.S. judge blocked the pending $8.5 billion merger of U.S. handbag and accessories maker Tapestry and Capri on Thursday, a victory for the U.S. Federal Trade Commission in an industry where merger challenges are rare.】

item.title: 得益于对 Hoka 鞋的强劲需求，Deckers Outdoors 上调了年销售额预期
item.description: 德克斯户外用品公司（Deckers Outdoor）周四公布的第二季度业绩超出华尔街预期，并上调了全年销售预期，原因是其 UGG 靴子和 Hoka 跑鞋等品牌继续在顾客中产生共鸣。【原文：Deckers Outdoor beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter results and raised its annual sales forecast on Thursday, as its brands such as UGG boots and Hoka running shoes continue to resonate with customers.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利任命首席执行官 Ted Pick 为主席
item.description: 摩根士丹利周四表示，首席执行官泰德-皮克（Ted Pick）将接替詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）担任下一任董事长。【原文：Morgan Stanley said on Thursday CEO Ted Pick would be its next chair succeeding James Gorman, who has been tapped to head the board at Walt Disney after he steps down as executive chair of the Wall Street titan at the end of the year.】

item.title: 美国法院阻止 Tapestry 85 亿美元收购竞争对手 Capri
item.description: 周四，一名美国法官阻止了美国手提包及配饰制造商 Tapestry 和 Capri 的 85 亿美元并购案，这是美国联邦贸易委员会在并购挑战罕见的行业中取得的一次胜利。【原文：A U.S. judge blocked the pending $8.5 billion merger of U.S. handbag and accessories maker Tapestry and Capri on Thursday, a victory for the U.S. Federal Trade Commission in an industry where merger challenges are rare.】

item.title: 瑞银首席执行官表示，瑞信客户迁移将耗时 18 个月
item.description: 瑞银集团首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）周四表示，瑞信客户向瑞银迁移的初期工作应该还需要 18 个月左右的时间，因为瑞银正在加紧整合其前竞争对手。【原文：The incipient migration of clients from Credit Suisse to UBS should take about another 18 months, UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti said on Thursday, as his bank presses on with the integration of its former rival.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Quikrete 正在洽谈收购 Summit Materials 公司
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，建筑材料供应商 Quikrete 已向竞争对手 Summit Materials 提出收购要约，后者市值超过 70 亿美元。【原文：Building materials provider Quikrete has approached rival Summit Materials , which has a market value of more than $7 billion, with an acquisition offer, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: Avangrid 以 1.6 亿美元向 Dominion Energy 出售海上风电租约
item.description: 伊贝尔德罗拉集团（Iberdrola Group）旗下的 Avangrid 公司周四表示，已完成将其 Kitty Hawk North 海上风电租约以 1.6 亿美元的价格出售给 Dominion Energy 公司。【原文：Avangrid , part of the Iberdrola Group, has completed the sale of its Kitty Hawk North offshore wind lease to Dominion Energy at $160 million, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长称将尽快解决部分财政问题
item.description: 巴西央行行长罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）周四表示，巴西政府将很快发布公告，部分解决金融市场对财政问题的担忧，这些问题正在影响该国的风险溢价。【原文：Brazil's government will make announcements soon that will partly address financial markets' fiscal concerns that are affecting the country's risk premium, central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto said on Thursday.】
